chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
G: AbelianGroup

Goal:
forall (u v : nat -> G) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => plus (u k) (v k)) n m = plus (sum_n_m u n m) (sum_n_m v n m)

Premises:
plus = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.plus G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
sum_n_m = fun (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat) => iter_nat plus zero a n m : (nat -> G) -> nat -> nat -> G Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
sum_n_m_Chasles : forall (a : nat -> G) (n m k : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> (m <= k)%nat -> sum_n_m a n k = plus (sum_n_m a n m) (sum_n_m a (S m) k)
sum_n_Sm : forall (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> sum_n_m a n (S m) = plus (sum_n_m a n m) (a (S m))
sum_Sn_m : forall (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat), (n <= m)%nat -> sum_n_m a n m = plus (a n) (sum_n_m a (S n) m)
sum_n_m_S : forall (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun n0 : nat => a (S n0)) n m = sum_n_m a (S n) (S m)
sum_n_m_ext_loc : forall (a b : nat -> G) (n m : nat), (forall k : nat, (n <= k <= m)%nat -> a k = b k) -> sum_n_m a n m = sum_n_m b n m
sum_n_m_ext : forall (a b : nat -> G) (n m : nat), (forall n0 : nat, a n0 = b n0) -> sum_n_m a n m = sum_n_m b n m
sum_n_m_zero : forall (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat), (m < n)%nat -> sum_n_m a n m = zero
sum_n_n : forall (a : nat -> G) (n : nat), sum_n_m a n n = a n
iter_nat_Chasles : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T), (forall x : ?T, op x0 x = x) -> (forall x y z : ?T, op x (op y z) = op (op x y) z) -> forall (a : nat -> ?T) (n m k : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> (m <= k)%nat -> iter_nat op x0 a n k = op (iter_nat op x0 a n m) (iter_nat op x0 a (S m) k) where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup |- Type]
iter_nat_ext_loc : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T) (a b : nat -> ?T) (n m : nat), (forall k : nat, (n <= k <= m)%nat -> a k = b k) -> iter_nat op x0 a n m = iter_nat op x0 b n m where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup |- Type]
iter_nat_S : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T) (a : nat -> ?T) (n m : nat), iter_nat op x0 (fun n0 : nat => a (S n0)) n m = iter_nat op x0 a (S n) (S m) where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup |- Type]
sum_Sn : forall (a : nat -> G) (n : nat), sum_n a (S n) = plus (sum_n a n) (a (S n))
sum_n_m_const_zero : forall n m : nat, sum_n_m (fun _ : nat => zero) n m = zero
sum_n = fun (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
sigma_split : forall (f : nat -> R) (low high k : nat), (low <= k)%nat -> (k < high)%nat -> sigma f low high = sigma f low k + sigma f (S k) high
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0%nat => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
plus_INR : forall n m : nat, INR (n + m) = INR n + INR m
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => n | S k => match m with | 0%nat => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
plus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, S (n + m) = (n + S m)%nat
Nat.add_succ_r : forall n m : nat, (n + S m)%nat = S (n + m)
sum_n_ext_loc : forall (a b : nat -> G) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> a n = b n) -> sum_n a N = sum_n b N
Nat.zero_or_succ : forall n : nat, n = 0%nat \/ (exists m : nat, n = S m)
AbelianGroup.ax3 : forall (G : Type) (m : AbelianGroup.mixin_of G) (x : G), AbelianGroup.plus G m x (AbelianGroup.zero G m) = x
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | (i < m)%nat} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | (i < n0)%nat} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => (i < S j)%nat) 0%nat (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => (i0 < S n0)%nat) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | (i < m)%nat} Argument m is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [nat_scope _]
sum_n_ext : forall (a b : nat -> G) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> sum_n a N = sum_n b N
Nat.are_bits : forall f : nat -> bool, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) f -> (exists n : nat, Nat.eqf f (Nat.testbit n)) < -> (exists k : nat, forall m : nat, (k <= m)%nat -> f m = false)
sigma = fun (f : nat -> R) (low high : nat) => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => f (low + k)%nat) (high - low) : (nat -> R) -> nat -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
Record mixin_of (G : Type) : Type := Mixin { plus : G -> G -> G; opp : G -> G; zero : G; ax1 : forall x y : G, plus x y = plus y x; ax2 : forall x y z : G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z; ax3 : forall x : G, plus x zero = x; ax4 : forall x : G, plus x (opp x) = zero } For mixin_of: Argument scope is [type_scope] For Mixin: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
minus = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (x y : G) => plus x (opp y) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
